The 'British Aerospace 125' (Originally the de Havilland DH125 Jet Dragon) is a
twin-engine mid-size corporate jet, with newer variants now marketed as the
Hawker 800. It was known as the 'Hawker Siddeley HS.125' until 1977. It was also
used by the Royal Air Force as a navigation trainer (as the 'Hawker Siddeley
Dominie T1') until January 2011, and was used by the United States
Air Force as a calibration aircraft (as the 'C-29').
